meanings.definition: The act or process of converting information into digital format.
meanings.sent1: The digitizations of old photographs made them easier to share online.
meanings.sent2: I completed the digitizations of all the paper documents in the office.
meanings.sent3: The digitizations of the ancient scrolls revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a machine, performing digitizations of data effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's digitizations of nature were so realistic, they looked like photographs.

meanings.definition: The result of converting information into digital format.
meanings.sent1: We were amazed by the quality of the digitizations of the old records.
meanings.sent2: The company's digitizations of their archives saved a lot of physical space.
meanings.sent3: The digitizations of the recipe book made cooking more convenient.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like digitizations, clear and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The digitizations of the map were so detailed, you could zoom in to see street names.
